resources.string: Use the green button to select a trial
No Trials Available.\nUse Import to load some.
No Traits Available.\nUse Import to load some.
No Tags Available.\nUse Import to load some.
Names the device operator for KDXchange
Blank for NO, * for all Traits,\nor fragment of Trait Name
Use a white background when scoring for high outside visibility
Prevent accidental change for scored traits
Start in left-handed mode when scoring traits
Import Trial: Select CSV or KDX File
KDX Trial Export: Select Output Folder
KDX Trait Export: Select Output Folder
KDX Tag Export: Select Output Folder
Next sample is not in adjacent %1$s
Previous sample is not in adjacent %1$s
Check to confirm location and uncheck for a brief message.
Check to use location for scoring
Auto-advance is ON\nTouch again to turn it OFF
Auto-advance is OFF\nTouch again to turn it ON
You may wish to run a Trial Scores Validation check
Can\'t change data type, trait was scored before

The tag/s selected for deletion will be listed, along with any tag/s that are unable to be deleted because they are used in a current trial.

Select the \u2713 to delete any listed tag/s that are not used in a trial.

Select the \u2718 to cancel the deletion of the tag/s.

The trial/s selected for deletion will be listed.

Select the \u2713 to delete any listed trial/s.

Select the \u2718 to cancel the deletion of the trial/s.

The trait/s selected for deletion will be listed, along with any trait/s that are unable to be deleted because they are used in a current trial.

Select the \u2713 to delete any listed trait/s that are not used in a trial.

Select the \u2718 to cancel the deletion of the trait/s.

The Add Tag Bundle Screen allows for the creation of new tag bundles or the addition of tags to existing bundles. Ensure that all tags to be added or bundled are selected and then select the Create Tag Bundle Button.

The Add Tag Bundle Screen will list all selected tags and all previously created bundles. A text field for the bundle name will also be left blank. To create a new tag bundle, enter a bundle name in the blank field and then select the Create Button.

To add the selected tags to an existing bundle, either type the name of that bundle in the text field or select a listed bundle with a short press then select the Add Button.

The Add Trait Bundle Screen allows for the creation of new trait bundles or the addition of traits to existing bundles. Ensure that all traits to be added or bundled are selected and then select the Create Trait Bundle Button.

The Add Trait Bundle Screen will list all selected tags and all previously created bundles. A text field for the bundle name will also be left blank. To create a new trait bundle, enter a bundle name in the blank field and then select the Create Button.

To add the selected traits to an existing bundle, either type the name of that bundle in the text field or select a listed bundle with a short press then select the Add Button.

The traits selected for removal from the trait bundle are listed on this screen and removal needs to be confirmed.

Select the \u2713 to confirm the removal of the trait/s from the bundle.

Select the \u2718 to cancel the removal of the trait/s from the bundle.

Please note that removing a trait from a bundle does not delete the trait from the device.

The tags selected for removal from the tags bundle are listed on this screen and removal needs to be confirmed.

Select the \u2713 to confirm the removal of the tag/s from the bundle.

Select the \u2718 to cancel the removal of the tag/s from the bundle.

Please note that removing a tag from a bundle does not delete the tag from the device.

Any tag bundle/s that have been selected for deletion will appear in this Delete Tag Bundles Screen. Each bundle will be listed below, along with each tag that is a part of that bundle.

Select the \u2713 to confirm the deletion of the tag bundle.

Select the \u2718 to cancel the deletion of the tag bundle.

Please note that deleting a tag bundle does not delete the tags that it contains.

Any trait bundle/s that have been selected for deletion will appear in this Delete Trait Bundles Screen. Each bundle will be listed below, along with each trait that is a part of that bundle.

Select the \u2713 to confirm the deletion of the trait bundle.

Select the \u2718 to cancel the deletion of the trait bundle.

Please note that deleting a trait bundle does not delete the traits that it contains.

The Trial Screen displays all trials that are currently loaded into KDSmart.

Warning: Demonstration Mode should NOT be used for your real trials. It is ONLY intended for demonstration and training purposes. All data in Demonstration Mode can be lost with any version upgrades or by choosing the Reset Demo Data option in Settings which restores the demonstration data. Demonstration Mode is indicated by DEMO DBappearing on the Home Screen.

To display details for a trial, choose the trial with a short press. This will take you to the Trial Details Screen.

If a trial is highlighted, you can perform the following actions on it along with general actions in the Menu:

  • Start Scoring - Opens the Scoring Configuration Screen for any highlighted trial;
  • Import Trial - Options for importing trials from either the device or from KDXPlore with KDXchange;
  • Share - Sharing options for the highlighted trial with Android\'s Storage Access Framework including email, Bluetooth, or any file sharing service installed on the device;
  • Export To - Export options of any highlighted trial for exporting files to the device;
  • Clone Trial - Creates a clone of any highlighted trial which contains the same data and traits;
  • Delete - Deletes any highlighted trial;
  • Sort … - Options for sorting trials;
  • Grouping - Options for groups trials;
  • Random Demo Data - A tool for applying random demonstration data to a trial including attachments (only in Demonstration Mode);
    • Score Samples - Generates sample data with the probability of a sample being scored ranging from 10%-100%;
    • Add Attachments - Generates attachments and tags;
    • Clear All Data - Clears all sample data for the selected demo trial;
  • Add Trial - Options for creating a new trial; and
  • Help - Opens this help page.

Use a long press on one or more trials to select them for further actions. Note that more than one trial can be selected at once. The extra actions that selection can display are:

  • Select/Deselect All - Selects or deselects all trials;
  • Share - Sharing options for the highlighted trials with Android\'s Storage Access Framework including email, Bluetooth, or any file sharing service installed on the device;
  • Export To - Export options of any highlighted trait for exporting files to the device;
  • Add %2$s - Add %2$s to each %1$s in any trial. Please note that this is choosing the number of %2$s that each %1$s will have and will not add the selected amount to the currently existing %1$s. For example, if each %1$s in a trial already has one %2$s but you want to add one more, then choose \'2\' and not \'1\';
  • Add Trait Bundle - Add a trait bundle to a trial; and
  • Add Bundle - Create a new trial bundle with 2 or more selected trials.

The Options Tab of the Scoring Configuration Screen provides general options for scoring the selected trial. These options will be saved for next time if the trial is opened with a quick start from the Home Screen.

Collection Order

The collection order is the order that you will move from one %1$s to the next and is chosen by selecting one of the 16 radio buttons that provide options. This is only relevant in Path Scoring Mode. There are three considerations for the collection order:

1. Origin - The corner of the field to start scoring in. This is determined by what corner is chosen e.g. lower-left;
2. Direction - What direction will be taken from the origin e.g. left to right from the lower-left origin; and
3. Path - Choose a serpentine or straight path.

The default collection order option is serpentine, left to right from the lower-left. The default can be changed in the Settings.

Scoring View

Scoring views change the way that you score data.

  • Spreadsheet Scoring Mode is a traditional spreadsheet view with added features;
  • Path Scoring Mode is the best choice for most users and allows for easy navigation between %1$s; and
  • Field Scoring Mode which represents the field from a top-down perspective.

The default scoring mode can also be set in Settings

Field View is also available in Spreadsheet Scoring Mode and Path Scoring Mode but it not the main method of navigation and scoring. Field Scoring Mode also contains a spreadsheet like in Spreadsheet Scoring Mode.

%1$s Per Group

How many %1$s to score at one time e.g. scoring each %1$s to your left and right whilst walking along the field would be two %1$s.

Lock Scored Traits

Select the Lock Scored Trait Checkbox to prevent accidentally overwriting traits that have already been scored. Measurements can still be changed but there will be a warning message.

High Outside Visibility

This will determine if scoring is done in a dark or light mode. Select the checkbox to ensure that scoring is in a high visibility (light) mode or deselect it to score in dark mode.

The Trial Screen displays all trials that are currently loaded into KDSmart.

To display the details for a trait, choose the trait with a short press. This will take you to the Trait Details Screen.

If a trait is highlighted, you can perform the following actions on it along with general actions in the Menu:

  • Edit Trait - Opens that Trait Edit Screen for any highlighted trait;
  • Add Trait - Opens the Add Trait Screen where new traits can be created;
  • Import From - Options for importing traits from either the device or from KDXplore with KDXchange;
  • Share - Sharing options for the highlighted trait with Android\'s Storage Access Framework including email, Bluetooth, or any file sharing service installed on the device;
  • Export To - Export options of any highlighted trait for exporting files to the device;
  • Delete - Options to delete the highlighted trait or remove it from a trait bundle;
  • Italics for Protected - Select the checkbox to ensure that the text for protected traits is in italics;
  • Numeric Keypad Text Size - Options for text size of the keypad in the Scoring Screen;
  • Scanner On - Opens the Paired Devices Window;
  • Refresh List - Refreshes list of traits;
  • Bluetooth On/Off - Turns the device Bluetooth on or off;
  • Sort … - Options for sorting traits; and
  • Help - Opens this help page.

Use a long press on one or more traits to select them for further actions. Note that more than one trait can be selected at once. The extra actions that selection can display are:

  • Select/Deselect All - Selects or deselects all traits;
  • Share - Sharing options for the highlighted trait with Android\'s Storage Access Framework including email, Bluetooth, or any file sharing service installed on the device;
  • Export To - Export options of any highlighted trait for exporting files to the device;
  • Create Trait Bundle - Opens the Add Trait Bundle Screen where you can create new trait bundles and add the select traits to existing ones; and
  • Delete - Options to delete the highlighted trait or remove it from a trait bundle.

This screen provides information on a selected trial. Swipe left and right to select different trials that are on the device. Many of the same options from the Trials Screen including sharing and deleting are still available including sharing and deleting the trial (see the help for the Trials Screen for more information).

The Edit Button will allow for editing or adding any trial details. All details are listed below:

  • Trial Name - Name of the selected trial. This cannot be edited.
  • Abbreviation - Abbreviated name of the trial.
  • Planting Date - Date that specimens were planted.
  • %1$s & X/Y Axis Names - Change the X/Y axis names and %1$s names. They are set to %1$s, %4$s, and Range by default but can be anything.
  • %1$s Identification - %1$s identification options.
  • Trial Layout - Provides options for setting the trial layout. These options will depend on the type of trial layout as outlined below:
    • %1$s X/Y Trial Layout - A trial where the %1$s are labelled by their x/y coordinates (e.g. %1$s 3,2) which has the following option:
      • Origin - Sets where to start and the direction to score in.
    • %1$s Id Trial Layout - A trial where the %1$s are labelled by unique Id\'s (e.g. %1$s 12) which has the following options:
      • Origin - Sets where to start and the direction to score in.
      • Traversal - Traversal pattern within each trial e.g serpentine or one way (traversal for the trial can be chosen in Scoring Configuration).
      • Run Length - Indicates the number of %1$s occurring before changing traversal
      • Origin %1$s ID - The starting %1$s ID.
    • Block Trial Layout - A trial that contains blocks which are subsets of adjacent %1$s within a trial:
      • Block Layout - Sets where to start and the direction to score in within each block.
      • Traversal - Traversal pattern within each block e.g serpentine or one way (traversal for the trial can be chosen in Scoring Configuration).
      • Run Length - Indicates the number of %1$s within a block occurring before changing traversal.
      • Origin Block ID - The starting Block ID.
      • %1$s Origin in Block - Indicates the origin of %1$s in all blocks.
  • Organism Type - Set to generic by default but can be changed to plant, maize, wheat, or DNA. This options will change the icon that is used for %2$s (specimens) in the trial.
  • Note - Add a note to the trial.
  • Traits - Lists traits in the trial and indicates how many trait instances are available for each trait (see below for more information).
  • Trial Attributes - Attributes that apply to the whole trial.
  • %1$s Types - Types of %1$s that are in the trial.
  • %1$s Attributes - Attributes that apply to %1$s.

The Traits Option will open the Trait Instances Screen. It lists traits in the trial and indicates how many trait instances are available for each trait. A full star indicates the trait will be scored, an empty star indicates that the trait will be hidden when scoring, and a half-filled star demonstrates that there are multiple instances for a trait but at least one of them will be hidden. This is helpful for selecting only the traits that need to be scored. The following general options are available here:

  • Select None/Select All - Deselects or selects all traits.
  • Add Traits - Adds traits to the trials (this can be found by selecting the Menu Button).
  • Change Order - Choose the order that traits will be scored in (this can be found by selecting the Menu Button).

More trait instance options for each individual trait cab be found by selecting the Trait Instance Button:

  • Add Instance - Creates instances for the selected trait. Choose this option again to create another instance.
  • Move Up - Moves the trait up in the scoring order.
  • Move Down - Moves the trait down in the scoring order.
  • Edit Description - Edit the description of the instance.
  • Remove Trait - Removes the trait from the trial.

Use the Export To action to export a single Trial.

Use the Delete action to remove selected Trials from the database.

Cancel using the "tick" in the left of the Action Bar.

Exercise caution when deleting Trials. As a precaution ensure any Trial export was successful by first viewing and checking the Trial CSV contents or viewing Trial data in KDXplore before deleting from KDSmart.

The Tags Screen displays all tags that are currently available in KDSmart.

To display the details for a tag, choose the tag with a short press. This will take you to the Tag Details Screen.

If a tag is highlighted, you can perform the following actions on it along with general actions in the Menu:

  • Edit Tag - Opens that Tag Edit Screen for any highlighted tag;
  • Create Tag - Opens the Create Tag Screen where new tags can be created;
  • Import From - Options for importing tags from either the device or from KDXplore with KDXchange;
  • Share - Sharing options for the highlighted tag with Android\'s Storage Access Framework including email, Bluetooth, or any file sharing service installed on the device;
  • Export To - Export options of any highlighted tag for exporting files to the device;
  • Delete - Options to delete the highlighted tag or remove it from a tag bundle;
  • Sort … - Options for sorting traits; and
  • Help - Opens this help page.

Use a long press on one or more tags to select them for further actions. Note that more than one tag can be selected at once. The extra actions that selection can display are:

  • Select/Deselect All - Selects or deselects all tags;
  • Share - Sharing options for the highlighted tags with Android\'s Storage Access Framework including email, Bluetooth, or any file sharing service installed on the device;
  • Export To - Export options of any highlighted trait for exporting files to the device;
  • Create Tag Bundle - Opens the Add Tag Bundle Screen where you can create new tag bundles and add the select tags to existing ones; and
  • Delete - Options to delete the highlighted tag or remove it from a tag bundle.

This screen provides information on a selected trait. Swipe left and right to select different traits that are on the device. The menu options from the Traits Screen are still available including sharing and deleting the trial (see the help for the Traits Screen for more information). The following fields are listed for the details of a selected trait:

  • Trait Name - The name for the trait;
  • Alias - An alias or shortened name for the trait;
  • %1$s/%2$s Level Button - An icon to the right of the name which indicates whether the trait is at the %1$s or %2$s level;
  • Description - A text field for a description of the trait;
  • Trait Unit** - The unit that is being measured e.g. centimetres;
  • Data Type - One of the available data types which are:
    • Text - Alphanumeric text.
    • Categorical - Categories such as colours can be created. An other option can also be chosen will provide an option to include a text value instead of a category.
    • Date e.g. 10/08/2019
    • Elapsed Days - A value for days before or after the trial\'s planting date.
    • Integer e.g. 4
    • Decimal e.g. 4.4
  • Test Validation Button - Will provide a test for the validation rule that has been set for the trait.

Spreadsheet View is the is a simple version of the spreadsheet available in Spreadsheet Scoring Mode.

Spreadsheet View is a simple sheet-style view, similar to CSV or Excel document. This view presents all traits for %1$s and %2$s in a spreadsheet and selecting a cell will allow for entering of data. It has limited %1$s navigation features and can be slower to score, but many users find the view familiar and easy to use. It differs from Spreadsheet Scoring Mode in that it has more limited options it is used in conjunction with Field Scoring Mode. The %1$s available in Spreadsheet View are the %1$s selected in Field Scoring Mode.

Scoring

To score either a %1$s-level or %2$s level trait, select the trait value to open the Trait Measurement Screen. The data that needs to be entered will depend on the trait data type e.g. integer, category, decimal, etc. Swipe between the Trait Tab and the %1$s Info Tab to see more information about the current %1$s. The following buttons are available to use for scoring traits:

  • Cancel Button - Cancels the scoring of the selected trait. Cancelling will return the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Delete Value Button - Deletes a current value and returns the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Missing Value Button - Applies the value of Missing to a trait instance. This can be used if the actual value is missing;
  • Not Applicable Button - Applies the value of Not Applicable to a trait instance. This can be used when the trait does not need to be scored for the selected %1$s or %2$s;
  • Accept Value Button - Accepts and applies a value that has been entered such as confirming a decimal trait; and
  • Date Button - Opens a Date Picker so that a date can be chosen (only available for elapsed days traits).

%1$s/%2$s

Along with listed traits, each %1$s and %2$s will have a %1$s/%2$s Button. The following options are available for a %1$s Button:

  • Add %2$s - Adds a single %2$s to the %1$s (%2$s can be bulk added in the Trials Screen);
  • Edit Note - Opens a window where notes on the %1$s can be written; and
  • Deactivate %1$s - Deactivates the %1$s for scoring.

The %2$s Button contains the following options:

  • Edit Note - Opens a window where notes on the %1$s can be written; and
  • Deactivate %2$s - Deactivates the %2$s for scoring.

Tags that have been assigned to each %1$s or %2$s will be visible under the %1$s or %2$s number as a button that when pressed will open a window that displays information on the tag. More tags can be assigned to %1$s and %2$s by selecting the respective Tag Button. This will open the Tags Window where any available tags can be applied by selecting the checkbox and then the Confirm Button. Select the Add Button to open up a window where a new tag can be created.

Attachments for each %1$s and %2$s can also be added by selecting the Attachment Button to open up the Attachments Screen. Both audio and image attachments can be taken, viewed, and deleted if necessary.

Menu

The following menu options are available to configure scoring in Spreadsheet View:

  • Adjust Column Width - Opens a slider to adjust the width of columns;
  • Text Size - Provides text size options for the traits in the first row of the spreadsheet; and
  • Show/Hide All %2$s - Expands/subtracts %1$s to show/hide %2$s.

The label and description of the tag selected for editing will be displayed on this screen.

The tag label cannot be edited but the description can be.

After a description is edited, select the \u2713 to confirm the description change.

A Save Confirmation Dialogue will be displayed where the edit can be cancelled or confirmed. Select the Edit Button to return to the Edit Tags Screen.

Select the \u2718  to cancel the tag edit.

The Create Tag Screen allows users to create a new tag within KDSmart. The following options are available for creating a tag:

  • Label - The label/name of the tag.
  • Description - A description of the tag.

Once all options have been chosen, select the \u2713 to create the tag or the \u2718 to cancel the tag creation.

The Edit Traits Screen provides options for editing existing traits. The number of options that will be available to edit will depend on whether a trait is protected or not.

A protected trait is one that has been imported with a Database Trait ID. For protected traits, only changes to the trait alias and to the validation rule are permitted. However, the validation rule may only be changed for INTEGER and DECIMAL traits and to make the acceptable range smaller.

For traits that are not protected, any detail except for the trait name can be edited.

After edits have been made, select the \u2713 to save all edits made.

Select the \u2718 to cancel edits that have been made to the trait.

The Add Trait Screen allows users to create a new trait within KDSmart. The following options are available for creating a trait:

  • Trait Name - The name for the new trait. Once a name is entered, select the Use Button to choose the name that has been entered. This will check to see if there are any traits with the same name as each trait (of the same data type) must have a unique name within KDSmart.
  • Alias - An alias or shortened name for the trait.
  • %1$s/%2$s Level Button - By default, all new traits will be set to be %1$s level traits. Select this button to change the trait to %2$s level.
  • Description - A text field for a description of the trait.
  • Trait Unit** - The unit that is being measured e.g. centimetres.
  • Data Type - One of the available data types can be chosen which are:
    • Text - Alphanumeric text.
    • Categorical - Categories such as colours can be created. An other option can also be chosen will provide an option to include a text value instead of a category.
    • Date e.g. 10/08/2019
    • Elapsed Days - A value for days before or after the trial\'s planting date.
    • Integer e.g. 4
    • Decimal e.g. 4.4

Once all options have been chosen, select the \u2713 to create the tag or the \u2718 to cancel the tag creation.

In Path Scoring Mode, you will only select one %1$s at a time, for which you will be able to see all %1$s info, including %1$s traits, %2$s, %2$s traits, tags, etc. This mode is designed for easy navigation between %1$s as you physically walk through a field, score the traits, then move to the next %1$s on the Scoring Screen. This also allows the user to choose the Auto-Advance Mode which is the quickest way to score but will be explained further below. Additionally, Path Scoring Mode includes Field View which displays a top-down view of your field.

Path Scoring Mode is designed for easy navigation between %1$s as the user physically walks through a field, scores the traits, and then moves to the next %1$s on the Scoring Screen.

The number of %1$s available to score at once will depend on the size of the Visit Group that will be determined in the Scoring Configuration and will be between one and four. If the visit group is more than one, then the current %1$s will be in blue text and the others will be in black. Select another %1$s with a short press to display its details.

The %1$s information, %1$s-level traits, and %2$s level traits of the current %1$s will be listed.

Scoring

To score either a %1$s-level or %2$s level trait, select the trait to open the Trait Measurement Screen. The data that needs to be entered will depend on the trait data type e.g. integer, category, decimal, etc. Swipe between the Trait Tab and the %1$s Info Tab to see more information about the current %1$s. The following buttons are available to use for scoring traits:

  • Cancel Button - Cancels the scoring of the selected trait. Cancelling will return the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Delete Value Button - Deletes a current value and returns the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Missing Value Button - Applies the value of Missing to a trait instance. This can be used if the actual value is missing;
  • Not Applicable Button - Applies the value of Not Applicable to a trait instance. This can be used when the trait does not need to be scored for the selected %1$s or %2$s;
  • Accept Value Button - Accepts and applies a value that has been entered such as confirming a decimal trait;
  • Date Button - Opens a Date Picker so that a date can be chosen (only available for elapsed days traits);
  • Backward Button - Navigates to the previous trait instance (only available in Auto-Advance Mode); and
  • Forward Button - Navigates to the next trait instance by skipping the current trait (only available in Auto-Advance Mode).

%1$s/%2$s

Along with listed traits, each %1$s and %2$s will have a %1$s/%2$s Button. The following options are available for a %1$s Button:

  • Add %2$s - Adds a single %2$s to the %1$s (%2$s can be bulk added in the Trials Screen);
  • Edit Note - Opens a window where notes on the %1$s can be written; and
  • Deactivate %1$s - Deactivates the %1$s for scoring.

The %2$s Button contains the following options:

  • Edit Note - Opens a window where notes on the %1$s can be written; and
  • Deactivate %2$s - Deactivates the %2$s for scoring.

Tags that have been assigned to each %1$s or %2$s will be visible under the %1$s or %2$s number as a button that when pressed will open a window that displays information on the tag. More tags can be assigned to %1$s and %2$s by selecting the respective Tag Button. This will open the Tags Window where any available tags can be applied by selecting the checkbox and then the Confirm Button. Select the Add Button to open up a window where a new tag can be created.

Attachments for each %1$s and %2$s can also be added by selecting the Attachment Button to open up the Attachments Screen. Both audio and image attachments can be taken, viewed, and deleted if necessary.

Navigation

After all traits on a %1$s have been scored, you will need to navigate to the next %1$s.

Navigation in Path Scoring Mode can be done in four different ways:

1. Select a %1$s Button to open the Select %1$s Window where the %1$s number or %3$s/%4$s numbers can be entered to navigate to that %1$s;
2. Select the Advance/Retreat Buttons to move to the next or previous %1$s. This will be determined by the collection order;
3. Open the Field View with the Field View Button and select a %1$s, then select the Jump To Button to move to that %1$s; and
4. The Auto-Advance feature allows for automatic navigation to the next %1$s. See the Help For Auto-Advance for more information on using this feature.

Menu

The following menu options are available to configure scoring in Path Scoring Mode:

  • Auto-Advance - Opens the Auto-Advance Window which displays auto-advance options;
  • Field View - Opens the trial in Field View. More information on Field View can be found in the Field View Help;
  • Scan Barcode - Opens the Barcode Scanner so that trait or %1$s barcodes can be scanned;
  • Swap Sides - Changes KDSmart portrait orientation between Right-Handed and Left-Handed Mode;
  • Scanner On - Opens the Paired Devices Window;
  • Configure … - Displays configuration options:
    • Numeric Keypad Text Size - Options for text size of the keypad in the Scoring Screen;
    • Configure %1$s Info - %1$s information text size and display options; and
    • How to View Attachments - Choose an application to view attachments.
  • Change Screen Orientation - Changes KDSmart between Landscape and Portrait Orientation;
  • Lock/Unlock Scored Traits - Scored traits that are locked will require a confirmation to change the value;
  • Elapsed Days as Count - Change the display of elapsed days from a date to the number of days since the trial planting date;
  • Offer N Days for Date - When checked, date traits will be scored by choosing a day that is up to three days out from the planting date. If not checked, date traits are scored with a Date Picker;
  • Location .. - Provides options for recording locations:
    • GPS - for higher accuracy;
    • Network - lower accuracy; and
    • Do not use location.
  • Help - Opens this help page.

The Location option in the Scoring Menu lets you record a location whenever a sample measurement is scored. There are two levels of accuracy supported:

  • GPS: Uses GPS satellites and provides a location - usually 7 metres (20 feet) or better; and
  • Network: Uses the Wi-Fi or mobile network and provides an accuracy that may be within 70 metres (or 200 feet).

The accuracy of the location for GPS depends on the number of satellites the device is able to detect. This option may also use more power than the Network option.

If you are outside in the field, you should use the GPS option. However, if you are inside a building, use the Network option as GPS may take some time to find the satellites.

Regardless of your choice, the option chosen will determine the accuracy and power consumption so choose the option that is appropriate for your needs.

Auto-advance enables the fast and efficient measurement of traits in Path Scoring Mode. It works by automatically moving to the next trait after a trait is scored.

To enable Auto-advance, select the Auto-advance Button. This will display a window that provides the following options:

  • Auto-advance Is Off - This option will turn off Auto-advance.
  • All traits - Auto-advance will move to every trait, even if it has already been scored.
  • Unscored Traits - Auto-advance will only move to traits that have not been scored yet.

Once Auto-advance is active, select any %1$s or %2$s level trait to begin scoring. It will open up the Trait Measurement Screen where a trait value can be set. Once a value is set, the screen will be transitioned to the next trait to score. What trait is next will depend on both collection order and trait order which can be determined in the Options Taband Trait/Instance Tab of the Scoring Configuration Screen. The Trait Measurement Screen will also provide additional Backward/Forward Buttons which will navigate to the previous trait or skip the current trait and move to the next.

There will be a transition animation when moving to another trait. It will automatically be set to rotate but this can be removed or changed in the Settings Screen under the Next Trait Transition option.

Return to the Scoring Screen and select the Auto-advance Button then the Auto-advance Is Off option to turn off Auto-advance.

Warning: If data being imported is for your real, live Trials/Experiments, please ensure KDSmart is NOT in Demonstration Mode. Demonstration Mode is only for Training and Demonstration and subsequent data loss can occur in that mode.

After selecting a file to import each column in the CSV must be assigned an attribute type. This determines how the data in the column will be interpreted. You may choose to NOT import a column as well as choosing whether the data is related to the Trial, a %1$s or a Trait Name that you will be scoring. If the file contains values for Traits these will be loaded into KDSmart.

KDSmart will make in informed guess about each column but you may override this by using the drop-down list next to each CSV Heading to direct how the data in the column is interpreted. Values from the first "data" row are displayed to assist you in this.

If unable to guess otherwise, KDSmart will assume that the CSV column represents a Trait Name. If you wish to record the same Trait on successive visits to the Trial site, you may use the Trait Instance functionality in KDSmart to do this; (this is not the same as the date/time scored value that KDSmart records with every measurement that you take).

Trait Instances provide this "temporal" separation so you don\'t need to define separate Traits for each scoring activity. KDSmart provides three alternatives to choose from on how to interpret the tail portion of a Trait Name:

◉ no Trait instances (no special interpretation)
◉ a colon (:) followed by the instance number
◉ two underscores followed by the instance number

Traits are defined to have a Trait Level. This tells KDSmart whether the Trait is for recording measurements for a %1$s or for a %2$s within the %1$s (i.e. "%2$s" data).

If the Trait has not been previously defined, you may choose to create the Trait as a Trait for %2$s. If, however, the Trait is already defined, KDSmart will automatically use the current definition.

The names marked with one or two asterisks (*) must be provided before you can import. You MUST provide at least one of:
◉ %1$s Id
OR
◉ %1$s %4$s and %1$s %3$s

If you only provide %1$s Id you should later edit the Trial Layout to set the Origin %1$s Id (this should be less than or equal to the lowest valued %1$s Id) and Run Length. This allows KDSmart to display the Trial\'s physical layout in the Field View.

Sample Measurement data in CSV files will be imported and assigned a date/time scored of the time of the CSV import.

Please read Appendix B of the KDSmart User Guide for more details.

Field View is a top-down look at the field which offers an alternative way to navigate between %1$s, search %1$s, and produce heatmaps. It provides different information depending on the level that it is being viewed at (how zoomed in/out you are). Whilst Field Scoring Mode uses an alternative Field View as a primary scoring method, this *Field View is available in Path Scoring Mode and Spreadsheet Scoring Mode as a secondary scoring method.

%1$s/%2$s

Different levels of information are available depending on what level of zoom is applied. The following information is available when fully zoomed in:

  • Arrows to indicate the direction of the collection order;
  • A grey bar to indicate the percentage of traits currently scored in the %1$s;
  • %1$s number or x/y coordinates;
  • %1$s types;
  • Black circles with numbers indicate the number of tags currently assigned to the %1$s. The tags are listed at higher levels of zoom;
  • White circles with numbers indicate the number of %2$s assigned to the %1$s; and
  • %1$s attributes.

A short press on a %1$s will also open a window that provides %1$s information. Select the ++ Button to add the %1$s to selected %1$s (it will be highlighted) and the — Button to remove it from the selection. The Jump To Button will open the Trait Measurement Screen for the %1$s.

Menu

The following menu options are available to configure scoring in Field View:

  • Search - Opens the Search Window;
  • Zoom Out - Demagnifies the field;
  • Zoom In - Magnifies the field;
  • Cancel Selection Mode - Exits Selection Mode so that %1$s can be short pressed without selecting the %1$s (only available when in Selection Mode;
  • Find Recent Scores - Options for finding %1$s that have been recently scored;
  • Show Trait When Scored;
  • Heat Map Settings - Options for heat map configuration;
  • Configure … - Displays configuration options:
  • Elapsed Days as Count - Change the display of elapsed days from a date to the number of days since the trial planting date; and
  • Help - Opens this help page.

KDXchange is a data transfer tool that can be used to transfer trials, traits, and tags between KDSmart and KDXplore. Before starting a connection, both the KDXplore device and the KDSmart device must be on the same Wi-Fi network.

Firstly ensure that the connection has been initiated on the KDXplore device (more information can be found at: http://www.kddart.org/help/kdsmart/html/exchangedata.html#data-exchange-kdxchange-method).

Next, the IP address of the KDXhange server from the KDXplore device will need to be added in KDSmart. Previously discovered KDXchange servers are displayed in the list. If none were previously discovered, KDSmart will automatically start searching.

The KDXchange server address and port number can be manually added using the Add Button.

Once the KDXchange server is available, select it to accept the connection from KDXplore. The connection then needs to also be accepted on the KDXplore device. At this point, you will be able to use the interface on KDXplore to view and transfer data between the devices.

If the Keep Server Addresses Checkbox is selected then KDSmart will remember all KDXchange server addresses that are used to connect to KDXplore.

To remove one or more server addresses, use a long press on a server name to select one or more servers and then select the Delete Button.

Use the Export To button to select a folder location to receive the output. The filename is automatically constructed from the Trial Name.

The first two Export Options omit Sample Measurements which are the Trait Instance scores and include the date/time at which the value was recorded. The options are:
◉ %1$s Only to omit measurements for %2$s
◉ %1$s & %2$s to include measurements for %2$s
◉ Full ZIP to output all measurements as well as any Attachments.

Check the Include Source Database Id option if you imported database identifiers for the Trial and wish to have these included in the export.

The date/time of each sample measurement is displayed in ISO-8601 format with a trailing time-zone indicator of either Z or the number of hours offset from UTC.

Note: Although the ISO-8601 date format includes the timezone, Microsoft Excel does not automatically interpret the values. Macros and Formulae for converting to Excel dates are available from
http://software.kddart.com/KDXplore/excel-support.html and a formula for conversion is: 

=DATEVALUE(LEFT(A1,10))

+ TIMEVALUE(MID(A1,12,8))

+ IF("Z"=MID(A1,20,LEN(A1)-19),

     0,

     (INT(MID(A1,20,LEN(A1)-19)/100)*60

      + MOD(MID(A1,20,LEN(A1)-19),100))/1440)

where the ISO-8601 date/time string is in cell A1.

A Heat Map can be created to graphically represent the scored trait values for any trait. This Heat Map can be found in the Active Traits Tab in the Search Window. The Search Window is available in any Field View/Scoring Mode.

The Active Traits Tab lists all traits with a \'(p)\' for %1$s-level traits and an \'(s)\' for %2$s level traits.

Select a trait and then the checkbox for all trait values to choose a trait. The Heat Map Button will then be available to select. Once selected, the Search Window will close and the Heat Map will be overlayed over the Field View.

Select the Heat Map Settings Button in the Menu for opacity and colour options for the Heat Map.

Use the spinner to choose a number of %2$s that each %1$s should have and select the Confirmation Tick to confirm. You will be presented with a %2$s Report which will detail the %2$s that were added to a %1$s. Please note that this tool is to choose the number of %2$s that each %1$s should have and not to just add more.

For example, if there are no %2$s in your trial and you choose to add two %2$s to each %1$s, then all new %2$s will be created. However, if you then decide that you want an extra two %2$s, you will need to enter the Add %2$s Screen again, and choose four (rather than two). If only the first %1$s already has two and the rest have none, then this tool will create two %2$s for %1$s 1, and four %2$s for each other %1$s.

Your device and the KDXchange server need to be on the same WiFi network. If they are not then it is unlikely that KDSmart can connect.
If "Connect Anyway" does not work, use the "Search" button to try to automatically discover a KDXchange server. If that also fails then you will have to manually provide the address of the KDXchange server using the "plus" button in the menu.

The Scanner tab shows the scanners available.

Functionality not yet available.

The Scales tab shows the scales available.

Functionality not yet available.

The Bluetooth Tab shows the Bluetooth devices that have been paired with this device and are currently available.

Select the Bluetooth Button to turn the device Bluetooth on or off. The Refresh Button will refresh the list of available Bluetooth devices.

Select a device in the list to initiate a connection.

The Database Tab provides options for backing up trials and the KDSmart database. The options available are listed below:

  • Output to Folder Button - Select this button to open the device Storage Access Framework (SAF) where a folder location can be chosen for saved files;
  • Save Button:
    • Trials as Zip - best for saving files as CSVs;
    • Trials as KDX - best for using with KDXplore; and
    • Database Files - for backing up all data.
  • Database Integrity Check Button - Initiates an integrity check of the local database; and
  • Update Block Trials Button - Resolves known issues with block trials.

%2$s tags must have # followed by number or *
%1$s traits with #* or # followed by a number not allowed
%1$s tags with #* or # followed by a number not allowed

Any trial bundle/s that have been selected for deletion will appear in this Delete Trial Bundles Screen. Each bundle will be listed below, along with each trial that is a part of that bundle.

Select the \u2713 to confirm the deletion of the trial bundle.

Select the \u2718 to cancel the deletion of the trial bundle.

Please note that deleting a trial bundle does not delete the trials that it contains.

The trials selected for removal from the trial bundle are listed on this screen and removal needs to be confirmed.

Select the \u2713 to confirm the removal of the trial/s from the bundle.

Select the \u2718 to cancel the removal of the trial/s from the bundle.

Please note that removing a trial from a bundle does not delete the trial from the device.

Field Scoring Mode uses the Field View as the primary view for scoring. It also has more options for bulk scoring that the other scoring modes do not have. To navigate to a %1$s in this mode, one or more %1$s can also be selected to score with a Spreadsheet View.

Scoring

Scoring in Field Scoring Mode can be done by either bulk scoring %1$s/%2$s or by using a Spreadsheet View to score with the Trait Measurement Screen. For either method, %1$s need to be selected.

A short press will open a %1$s Information Window with information on that %1$s. There is also a ++ Button which will select (highlight) that %1$s. Select the %1$s again and then the — Button to deselect the %1$s. More %1$s can also be selected with the same method. A quicker way to select %1$s is by entering Selection Mode by using a long press on any %1$s and any subsequent short press on a %1$s will add it to the selected %1$s. Select the Cancel Button to exit Selection Mode.

Once the desired %1$s are selected, select the Start Scoring Button to open a Spreadsheet View with only the selected %1$s. More information can be found in the help page in this view.

If only one %1$s is selected, the Bulk %2$s Scoring Button will be available. It will open a Bulk %2$s Scoring Screen where more information on bulk scoring %2$s can be found.

If one or more %1$s are selected, the Bulk %1$s Scoring Button will be available. This will also open a Bulk %1$s Scoring Screen where more information on bulk scoring %1$s can be found.

Similarly, bulk tagging can be achieved when %1$s/s are selected by selecting the Bulk Tags Button which will open the Bulk Tags Screen. More help is available on that screen.

%1$s/%2$s

Different levels of information are available depending on what level of zoom is applied. The following information is available when fully zoomed in:

  • Arrows to indicate the direction of the collection order;
  • A grey bar to indicate the percentage of traits currently scored in the %1$s;
  • %1$s number or x/y coordinates;
  • %1$s types;
  • Black circles with numbers indicate the number of tags currently assigned to the %1$s. The tags are listed at higher levels of zoom;
  • White circles with numbers indicate the number of %2$s assigned to the %1$s; and
  • %1$s attributes.

A short press on a %1$s will also open a window that provides %1$s information. The %1$s/%2$s Buttons for adding notes, deactivating %1$s/%2$s, adding attachments, and tagging are available in the Spreadsheet View.

Menu

The following menu options are available to configure scoring in Field Scoring Mode when not %1$s are selected (highlighted):

  • Search - Opens the Search Window;
  • Zoom Out - Demagnifies the field;
  • Zoom In - Magnifies the field;
  • Find Recent Scores - Options for finding %1$s that have been recently scored;
  • Show Trait When Scored;
  • Heat Map Settings - Options for heat map configuration;
  • Configure … - Displays configuration options:
    • Numeric Keypad Text Size - Options for text size of the keypad in the Scoring Screen;
    • Configure %1$s Info - %1$s information text size and display options; and
    • How to View Attachments - Choose an application to view attachments.
  • Elapsed Days as Count - Change the display of elapsed days from a date to the number of days since the trial planting date;
  • Change Screen Orientation - Changes KDSmart between Landscape and Portrait Orientation; and
  • Help - Opens this help page.

When %1$s are selected in Field Scoring Mode, there are different menu options which are as follows:

  • Bulk %1$s Scoring - Opens Bulk %1$s Scoring Screen to bulk score traits on one or more %1$s;
  • Bulk %2$s Scoring - Opens Bulk %2$s Scoring Screen to bulk score traits of all %2$s within one %1$s (only available when one %1$s is selected;
  • Bulk Tags - Opens Bulk Tagging Screen to tag multiple %1$s at once;
  • Cancel Selection Mode - Exits Selection Mode so that %1$s can be short pressed without selecting the %1$s.
  • Start Scoring - Opens the selected %1$s in Spreadsheet View; and
  • Change Screen Orientation - Changes KDSmart between Landscape and Portrait Orientation

Please select at least one %2$s trait instance to bulk add %2$s
Add trait bundles to trials or trial bundle

Couldn\'t add any traits from the selected trait bundle. All traits are already present in the trial.

Trial name cant be left empty

KDSmart can make maximum of 10 %2$s per %1$s

The Add Trait Bundles screen allows users to add trait bundles to a selected trial. Please note that trait bundles can only be added to one trial at a time.

The selected trial will be displayed at the top of the screen. All available trait bundles will be listed at the bottom of the screen. Select the checkbox of any trait bundle/s to be added and then select the \u2713 to complete the addition of the traits. Select the \u2718 to cancel the trait bundle addition.

This screen lists all traits and trait instances associated with the trial. A trait instance is a single occurrence of a trait being used. Multiple trait instances can be used in a trial so that one trait can be used more than once.

A trial may have many traits (or trait instances) associated with it however, all traits do not necessarily need to be visible or scored during every scoring session. Traits/instances may be hidden or visible to make scoring more efficient by decluttering the Scoring Screen in both Path and Spreadsheet Scoring Modes.

The Star Icon will determine whether the trait/instance will be used in the current scoring session. A filled star indicates that the trait will be used, the empty star indicates that it will not be used, and for traits with multiple instances, a half star indicates that not all instances will be used.

Select the star at the top of the list or the Select None/Select All Button to select or deselect all traits and instances. The Menu Button next to the Select None/All Buttonprovides the following options for the traits:

  • The Add Trait Bundle Button opens the Add Trait Bundle Screen where existing trait bundles can be added to the trial;
  • The Add Traits Button enables the selection of saved traits to add to the trial; and
  • The Trait Order Button option allows for choosing a trait scoring order.

The Manage Trait Button next to each trait/instance provides further options for each trait/instance:

  • Add a trait to the trial with the Add Trait Button;
  • The Move Up Button allows you to move the selected trait up in the scoring order;
  • The Move Down Button allows you to move the selected trait down in the scoring order;
  • Add a trait description with the Edit Description Button; and
  • Remove a trait from the trial with the Remove Button.

Traits with multiple instances are grouped by the trait name and have an instance number. Expand the trait by selecting the Dropdown Button or selecting the trait with a short press. A long press will select/deselect all instances of that trait for the scoring session.
Any listed tag bundle can be added with the checkboxes. More tag bundles can be imported or created in the Tags Screen.
Any block trial will have all blocks listed and selectable with the checkboxes. At least one must be chosen. This option will only be available for block trials.

The Add Trial Bundle Screen allows for the creation of new trait bundles or the addition of trials to existing bundles. Ensure that all trials to be added or bundled are selected and then select the Create Trial Bundle Button.

The Add Trial Bundle Screen will list all selected tags and all previously created bundles. A text field for the bundle name will also be left blank. To create a new trial bundle, enter a bundle name in the blank field and then select the Create Button.

To add the selected trials to an existing bundle, either type the name of that bundle in the text field or select a listed bundle with a short press then select the Add Button.

The Add Trial Screen allows users to create a new trial within KDSmart. The following options are available for creating a trial:

  • Trial Name - The name for the new trial.
  • Trial Type - Choose between either a %1$s X/Y trial where each %1$s has unique x/y coordinates, or a %1$s Id trial where each %1$s as a unique %1$s Id. The option that is chosen here will determine some of the next options.
  • Number of %3$s (%1$s X/Y trials) - The number of %1$s %3$s that will be created for the client.
  • Number of %4$s (%1$s X/Y trials) - The number of %4$s %3$s that will be created for the client.
  • First %1$s Id (%1$s Id trials) - The Id of the %1$s that should be the first %1$s in the trial.
  • Run Length (%1$s Id trials) - Indicates the number of %1$s within a trial occurring before changing traversal.
  • Number of %2$s per %1$s - Creates %2$s for each %1$s in the trial.
  • Trait Instance Style - Choose either the Trait:123 or Trait:_123 naming style for trait instances.

Once all options have been chosen, select the \u2713 to create the trial or the \u2718 to cancel the trial creation.

Sheet Scoring Mode is a simple sheet-style view, similar to CSV or Excel document. This mode presents all traits for %1$s and %2$s in a spreadsheet and selecting a cell will allow for entering of data. It has limited %1$s navigation features and can be slower to score, but many users find the view familiar and easy to use. Additionally, Spreadsheet Scoring Mode includes Field View which displays a top-down view of the field.

Scoring

To score either a %1$s-level or %2$s level trait, select the trait value to open the Trait Measurement Screen. The data that needs to be entered will depend on the trait data type e.g. integer, category, decimal, etc. Swipe between the Trait Tab and the %1$s Info Tab to see more information about the current %1$s. The following buttons are available to use for scoring traits:

  • Cancel Button - Cancels the scoring of the selected trait. Cancelling will return the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Delete Value Button - Deletes a current value and returns the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Missing Value Button - Applies the value of Missing to a trait instance. This can be used if the actual value is missing;
  • Not Applicable Button - Applies the value of Not Applicable to a trait instance. This can be used when the trait does not need to be scored for the selected pl%1$sot or %2$s;
  • Accept Value Button - Accepts and applies a value that has been entered such as confirming a decimal trait; and
  • Date Button - Opens a Date Picker so that a date can be chosen (only available for elapsed days traits).

%1$s/%2$s

Along with listed traits, each %1$s and %2$s will have a %1$s/%2$s Button. The following options are available for a %1$s Button:

  • Add %2$s - Adds a single %2$s to the %1$s (%2$s can be bulk added in the Trials Screen);
  • Edit Note - Opens a window where notes on the %1$s can be written; and
  • Deactivate %1$s - Deactivates the %1$s for scoring.

The %2$s Button contains the following options:

  • Edit Note - Opens a window where notes on the %1$s can be written; and
  • Deactivate %2$s - Deactivates the %2$s for scoring.

Tags that have been assigned to each %1$s or %2$s will be visible under the %1$s or %2$s number as a button that when pressed will open a window that displays information on the tag. More tags can be assigned to %1$s and %2$s by selecting the respective Tag Button. This will open the Tags Window where any available tags can be applied by selecting the checkbox and then the Confirm Button. Select the Add Button to open up a window where a new tag can be created.

Attachments for each %1$s and %2$s can also be added by selecting the Attachment Button to open up the Attachments Screen. Both audio and image attachments can be taken, viewed, and deleted if necessary.

Menu

The following menu options are available to configure scoring in Spreadsheet Scoring Mode:

  • Search - Opens the Search Window;
  • Zoom In/Out - Zooms in and out of the spreadsheet;
  • Field View - Opens the trial in Field View. More information on Field View can be found in the Field View Help;
  • Text Size - Provides text size options for the traits in the first row of the spreadsheet;
  • Adjust Column Width - Opens a slider to adjust the width of columns;
  • Location .. - Provides options for recording locations:
    • GPS - for higher accuracy;
    • Network - lower accuracy; and
    • Do not use location.
  • Scanner On - Opens the Paired Devices Window;
  • Configure … - Displays configuration options:
    • Numeric Keypad Text Size - Options for text size of the keypad in the Scoring Screen;
    • Configure %1$s Info - %1$s information text size and display options; and
    • How to View Attachments - Choose an application to view attachments.
  • Elapsed Days as Count - Change the display of elapsed days from a date to the number of days since the trial planting date;
  • Offer N Days for Date - When checked, date traits will be scored by choosing a day that is up to three days out from the planting date. If not checked, date traits are scored with a Date Picker;
  • Lock/Unlock Scored Traits - Scored traits that are locked will require a confirmation to change the value;
  • Change Screen Orientation - Changes KDSmart between Landscape and Portrait Orientation;
  • Choose %1$s Colours - Provides options to change the %1$s colours;
  • Show/Hide All %2$s - Expands/subtracts %1$s to show/hide %2$s;
  • Fixed %1$s Info - Provides options for adding columns to display %1$s information; and
  • Help - Opens this help page.

Bulk tagging is a feature where tags can be applied to %1$s and %2$s for one or more %1$s at once. It is only available in Field Scoring Mode

The Add or Remove Tags Switch can be selected to enable either the adding or removing of tags.

All available tags will be listed under the %1$s and %2$s headings. Use the drop-down arrows to expand the list if necessary. The # Added Columndisplays how many of the currently selected %1$s have had tags added or removed.

Select a tag to add/remove it from the selected %1$s/s and either cancel or confirm the dialogue that appears. This change will be reflected in the # Added Column. Any changes can be undone with the Undo Button.

Bulk %1$s Scoring is a feature where trait values can be applied to the same trait in one or more %1$s at once. It is only available in Field Scoring Mode.

The traits for each %1$s are listed in this screen and the # Scored Column indicates how many traits from the selected %1$s are already scored.

Select a trait to open the Trait Measurement Screen for the trait. The following buttons are available:

  • Cancel Button - Cancels the scoring of the selected trait. Cancelling will return the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Delete Value Button - Deletes a current value and returns the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Missing Value Button - Applies the value of Missing to a trait instance. This can be used if the actual value is missing;
  • Not Applicable Button - Applies the value of Not Applicable to a trait instance. This can be used when the trait does not need to be scored for the selected %1$s or %2$s;
  • Accept Value Button - Accepts and applies a value that has been entered such as confirming a decimal trait; and
  • Date Button - Opens a Date Picker so that a date can be chosen (only available for elapsed days traits).

After a trait value has been applied, select the Undo Button to undo any values. The Overwrite Trait Values Checkbox can be selected which will ensure that any traits that have already been applied are overwritten by the bulk scoring action.

%2$s Bulk Scoring is a feature where trait values can be applied to the same trait for all %2$s within a %1$s. It is only available in Field Scoring Mode.

The %2$s traits for the selected %1$s are listed in this screen and the # Scored Column indicates how many %2$s for each %1$s is already scored.

Select a trait to open the Trait Measurement Screen for the trait. The following buttons are available:

  • Cancel Button - Cancels the scoring of the selected trait. Cancelling will return the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Delete Value Button - Deletes a current value and returns the user to the Scoring Screen;
  • Missing Value Button - Applies the value of Missing to a trait instance. This can be used if the actual value is missing;
  • Not Applicable Button - Applies the value of Not Applicable to a trait instance. This can be used when the trait does not need to be scored for the selected %1$s or %2$s;
  • Accept Value Button - Accepts and applies a value that has been entered such as confirming a decimal trait; and
  • Date Button - Opens a Date Picker so that a date can be chosen (only available for elapsed days traits).

After a trait value has been applied, select the Undo Button to undo any values. The Overwrite Trait Values Checkbox can be selected which will ensure that any traits that have already been applied are overwritten by the bulk scoring action.

Server could not be reached, please check your internet connection

The KDDart Login Screen enables KDSmart users with internet access to connect to a KDDart database. Before you can connect to a database, you will need to set a KDDart URL by selecting the No KDDart URL Set link. This will take you to the KDSmart Settings where a new or existing KDDart URL can be chosen. Once a URL has been set, it will be displayed in the KDDart Login Screen but the link can still be selected so that the URL can be changed.

Enter the username and password provided to you by your KDDart administrator and select the Login Button to connect to KDDart. The Show/Hide Password Button can be used to toggle password visibility. Contact your KDDart administrator if you are having trouble logging in with your username or password, or contact kdsmart@diversityarrays.com for any other login related issues.

If you log into KDDart with a username that is associated with multiple groups, an additional Group Selection Screen will be displayed. Select the group that you want to log in to from the dropdown menu and then select the Select Group Button to complete the login process.
